intro: Laurus verticillata, commonly known as the bay laurel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Lauraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, dark green, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into dark blue berries. Its leaves are often used in cooking and have a strong, pungent scent. The plant is evergreen and can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters.
